inference: Final Answer: \\boxed{800}. I hope it is correct.
ground_truth: The $n^{th}$ ring can be partitioned into four rectangles: two containing $2n+1$ unit squares and two containing $2n-1$ unit squares. So there are $$2(2n+1)+2(2n-1) = 8n$$ unit squares in the $n^{th}$ ring. Thus, the $100^{th}$ ring has $8 \cdot 100 = \boxed{800}$ unit squares.
